result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven James Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning March 1, 2022.    Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven James Hoffmann

defendant.name: Hoffmann, Steven James
defendant.address: N1643 County Road G, Ogema, WI 54459

records.addlTxt: Amendment Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
and stipulation to amend judgment of conviction
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

02:47 PM Defendant Steven James Hoffmann in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Defendant Steven James Hoffmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Smith waives the reading of the complaint.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to count 1. Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 - felony bail jumping. Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Smith.  Court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  12 days of sentence credit.  The court costs shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning March 1, 2022.  - rt
Initial appearance on February 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:27 AM Defendant Steven James Hoffmann in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Defendant Steven James Hoffmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith is requesting a bond modification.  Argument by Attorney Smith.  Argument by Attorney Tlusty.  Court denies request to modify bond at this time.  Court may entertain revising the bond if a relative comes to court to indicate that he will live with them.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with C.R.C. - dob:8-22-2000.
Initial Appearance set March 1, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

11:55 am.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Steven J. Hoffmann appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty tried to contact the victim.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with C.R.C. - dob:  8-22-2000.  Court questions defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney and notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 1:30 pm.  - rt
